title.narrative: Romania: Reverse Trade Mission; Civil Nuclear Technologies, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This contract funds a reverse trade mission to introduce Romanian public and private sector officials to U.S. technology, regulations, and best practices in the civil nuclear energy industry. The delegates will travel to three cities in the United States to meet with U.S. companies and conduct relevant site visits.

NuScale Power Operational Value Streams (OVS), Limited Liability Corporation (LLC) is conducting the feasibility study.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Oil and Gas Sector, through Skipping Stone, LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission is identifying and evaluating opportunities in Romania's oil and gas sector for USTDA funding consideration. Romania is investing in modernization of its gas transmission pipeline systems, gas storage systems, and refineries to improve energy security in Romania and southeast Europe.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Transmission and Distribution, through Constant Group, LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission is identifying and evaluating opportunities in Romania's transmission and distribution sector for USTDA funding consideration. Romania is investing in the modernization of its electricity transmission and distribution sector and power interconnections with neighboring countries. This will improve the stability and efficiency of its grid and provide additional opportunities for electricity exports to neighboring countries.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Cybersecurity Innovation Center, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This $400,175 grant to Centrul National de Raspuns la Incidente de Securitate Cibernetica, CE (the Computer Emergency Response Team for Romania or CERT-RO) supports a feasibility study (FS) on a Cyber Security Innovation Center (Center) for Romania. The Center will help CERT-RO to improve cyber security knowledge, standards, and implementation in Romania. The FS is determining the feasibility, implementation strategy, and recommended design of the Center.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - NATIONAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This technical assistance assists the Romanian Ministry of Administration and Interior in coordinating projects within emergency agencies at the national and county level, and evaluating the telecommunications networks and environmental monitoring infrastructures needed to implement a national emergency management system.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - IT/E-LEARNING, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This Technical Assistance aids the Romanian Ministry of Education and Research (MOER) in the development of an Integrated Network for Education and Technologies (INET) project. The goal of INET is to upgrade existing networks and IT infrastructure at schools, universities and research centers to help develop students' skills to satisfy the growing needs of employers as well as the nation's need for improved innovation. INET will re-equip existing education and research networks with modern functionalities to enable e-learning and sharing of know-how with knowledge-based enterprises. INET will provide greater exposure to students at research centers, universities and schools to prepare users with skills needed to compete in the knowledge economy.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - TULCEA WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This $330,400 Feasibility Study on the Tulcea Water and Wastewater System Improvements project (a) examines and proposes rehabilitation methods for neglected water distribution and sewerage systems in the developed areas of Tulcea County, Romania, and (b) examines alternatives to the use of gaseous chlorine for the potable water disinfection in Romania's easternmost city of Sulina. These improvements will improve resource efficiency, reduce costs and eliminate environmental risks associated with wastewater leakage and gaseous chlorine transport.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - ELECTRONIC ELECTION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This $344,422 Feasibility Study (FS) grant develops a comprehensive roadmap for an Electronic Election Management System (EEMS) for Romania's Permanent Electoral Authority (PEA). Utilizing U.S. technologies, the study develops an integrated IT-based solution to improve the accuracy of voting and reduce the possibility for electoral fraud.

title.narrative: Desk Study - Desk Study: Virtual Power Plant Smart Grid Pilot Study Feasibility Study, through U.S. Power Consult LLC

description.narrative: This Desk Study reviews a proposal for a Virtual Power Plant Smart Grid Pilot Study Feasibility Study (FS) submitted by the Romanian national transmission and system operator (Transelectrica, S.A) and further develops the budget and Terms of Reference (TOR) for the proposed FS in Romania.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Aviation Surveillance Modernization, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This $513,170 grant funds a Technical Assistance for the Romanian AIr Traffic Services Administration (ROMATSA) to evaluate and recommend upgrades to aviation surveillance technology throughout Romania.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - TELEMEDICINE SOLUTIONS FOR RURAL AREAS, through Government of Romania

description.narrative: This $425,169 grant funds a feasibility study for the Romanian Ministry of Health to evaluate telemedicine solutions for rural areas in Romania.
